## GAD-7 vs STAI

In the field of psychology, there's often a need for comparison between different psychological questionnaires. A common one is GAD-7 vs STAI which stand for Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI). Comparing these two can be a challenging and time-consuming process, quite often involving tedious manual work. Fortunately, the Harmony software streamlines this process, providing an innovative and efficient solution to this issue. Harmony is a game-changing tool designed to simplify the harmonisation of different questionnaires, thereby facilitating the comparison of GAD-7 vs STAI. The software uses advanced natural language processing and generative AI models to identify the similarities and differences between the questionnaires, and offers a percentage match between the items of GAD-7 and STAI. This removes the need for manual comparison, saving precious time and reducing the chances of human error, enabling researchers to focus on the analysis and implications of their results. Furthermore, Harmony doesn't stop at comparing questionnaires in English. With its multilingual capabilities, it can be utilised to compare items in different languages as well, making it a truly versatile tool for global psychological and social researchers. Therefore, when it comes to GAD-7 vs STAI comparison, Harmony can provide researchers with a fast, efficient, accurate and comprehensive solution to their needs.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and STAI

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and STAI into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just STAI into Harmony</a> - compare STAI with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
